DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate two different analgesic regimen use acute postoperative pain .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Effectiveness Preemptive Paracetamol Ibuprofen Acute Postoperative Pain
DOC.detailed_description: Laparoscopic cholecystectomy type surgery cause moderate postoperative pain . Paracetamol non-steroid anti-inflammatory analgesic plus opioids mainstay treatment option moderate postoperative pain . These drug common use analgesic ameliorate type pain reduce consumption opioids side effect . Ibuprofen well-known anti-inflammatory drug use oral formula long time . Few study use new intravenous formula conduct evaluate effectiveness mixed type surgery . However , intravenous formula study laparoscopic cholecystectomy . Therefore , study compare effect postoperative analgesic potency preemptive intravenous paracetamol ibuprofen patient undergo laparoscopic cholecystectomy .
DOC.criteria: 1 . American Society Anesthesiologist Functional Status 12 2 . Body mass index small 30 3 . Undergoing laparoscopic cholecystectomy 4 . Age 1860 year 1 . Age 18 , 60 2 . Weight 40 kg 3 . Body mass index 30 4 . Contraindication opioid nonsteroid antiinflammatory drug usage 5 . Allergy paracetamol , opioids antiinflammatory drug 6 . Peptic ulcer 7 . Tendency bleed 8 . Pregnancy breast feed 9 . Moderate severe renal , hepatic cardiac insufficiency 10 . Coronary artery disease 11 . Asthma
